name: San Jose Fiesta
notes: A traditional fiesta in Davao de Oro's San Jose.
description: A community celebration involving music, food, and religious ceremonies.

name: Barotorera Festival
notes: Features boat racing as the highlight.
description: A water-based festival celebrating Gingoog’s fishing heritage, with boat races and related activities.

name: Araw ng Panabo
notes: Celebrates the founding anniversary of Panabo City.
description: Features cultural events, sports competitions, exhibits, and parades to mark Panabo’s founding day.

name: Kalap Festival
notes: A festival celebrating Calapan’s heritage and culture.
description: Incorporates parades, cultural presentations, and agricultural fairs, highlighting the city’s local industry and traditions.

name: Alimango Festival
notes: Celebrates the abundance of crabs ('alimango') in Lala.
description: Features crab-catching competitions, culinary exhibits, and street parades showcasing Lala’s crab industry.

name: Torugpo
notes: A Holy Week tradition featuring water buffalo fights.
description: Highlights the strength of water buffaloes with matches held as a traditional practice during the Holy Week.

name: Malaybalay City Chartered Day
notes: Celebrates the charter day of the city.
description: A community-wide observance of Malaybalay's history and progress with parades, concerts, and other ceremonial activities.

name: Sinugdan (Commemoration of the First Christian Mass)
notes: Marks the first Christian mass in the Philippines.
description: A historical reenactment of the first mass celebrated during Magellan’s expedition, with religious commemorations and cultural events.

name: First Easter Mass Celebration
notes: Marks the first recorded Easter mass in the Philippines.
description: Commemorates the first Christian Easter mass believed to have been held in Butuan, as part of the arrival of Catholicism in the Philippines.

name: Centurion Festival
notes: Believed to be the origin of the Moriones Festival.
description: A reenactment-focused Holy Week event commemorating Saint Longinus, with participants in colorful Roman costumes.

name: Kariton Festival
notes: Features carabao-pulled carts and agricultural-themed events.
description: A thanksgiving and harvest festival where participants decorate carabao-pulled carts and compete in parades and other festivities.

name: Moriones Festival
date: March (Holy Week to Easter Sunday) or April 2 to April 7
notes: A key Holy Week tradition in Marinduque, commemorating Saint Longinus.
description: Participants dress as Roman centurions, performing biblical reenactments and colorful parades during Holy Week.

name: Pagtaltal sa Guimaras (Ang Pagtaltal)
notes: Features a procession of flagellants and devotees in biblical attire.
description: A Holy Week celebration dramatizing the Passion and Crucifixion of Jesus Christ, featuring penitents performing acts of devotion.

name: Sugat Kabanhawan Festival
notes: Celebrates the meeting of the Risen Christ and the sorrowful Mother Mary.
description: A joyful Easter Sunday celebration with reenactments of the resurrection (Kabanhawan) combined with festive activities such as street dances and cultural shows.

name: Pantat Festival
notes: A festival celebrating the catfish ('Pantat'), the primary product of Zarraga.
description: The highlight is the parade and preparation of various catfish-inspired delicacies, showcasing its agricultural importance.

name: Manaoag Pilgrimage
notes: Pilgrims visit the Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Rosary of Manaoag.
description: A religious pilgrimage dedicated to the miraculous image of Nuestra Señora de Manaoag, known for granting petitions.

name: Lami-Lamihan Festival
notes: A vibrant festival celebrating Basilan's Yakan culture and heritage.
description: Highlights include displays of Yakan weaving, local delicacies, dances, and music unique to the Yakan people.

name: Mutya ng Taguig
notes: A pageant showcasing beauty, culture, and talent in Taguig.
description: An essential part of Taguig’s annual festival, with the crowning of 'Mutya ng Taguig' as the central event.

name: Tanduyong Festival
notes: Celebrated in honor of the town's abundant harvest of Tanduyong (onion).
description: Features colorful street dancing, floats, and a showcase of Nueva Ecija’s agricultural produce, especially onions.

name: Kamarikutan Pagdiwata Arts Festival
notes: A cultural festival observing the pagdiwata ritual, a thanksgiving for bountiful harvests.
description: Combines indigenous rituals, spiritual thanksgiving practices, and art exhibits celebrating nature and culture.

name: Camote Festival
notes: Dedicated to 'camote' (sweet potato) farming, a significant crop in Castillejos.
description: The festival features a variety of sweet potato-based dishes and farming competitions.

name: Itik Festival
notes: A festival celebrating the duck ('itik'), a prominent product of Victoria.
description: Features duck-themed street dances, recipes, and displays of 'balut' and egg farming industries of the town.

name: Kesong Puti Festival
notes: Celebrates Kesong Puti, a local delicacy made from carabao's milk.
description: Activities include culinary contests, street dancing, and exhibits of Kesong Puti and other local delicacies.

name: Semana Santa at Iguig Calvary Hills
notes: A Holy Week observance featuring the 14 Stations of the Cross.
description: Devotees gather for prayers and procession at the scenic Calvary Hills with life-sized Stations of the Cross sculptures.

name: Pasko sa Kasakit (Semana Santa sa Bantayan)
notes: Unique Holy Week traditions focusing on solemnity and faith.
description: Highlights the blend of Christian and cultural traditions, featuring religious processions and community gatherings.

name: The Subok
notes: Religious penitents enact Lenten traditions.
description: Features reenactments along mountain trails, concluding with vibrant celebrations of the Resurrection.

name: Pantuyan Festival
notes: A festival celebrating the pandan plant, which is used for weaving products.
description: Activities include cultural presentations, exhibits on pandan weaving, and product showcases to support local crafts.

name: Kanidugan Festival
notes: Celebrates the coconut tree ('niyog'), a vital resource in Odiongan.
description: A vibrant festival featuring coconut-themed competitions, cultural dances, and agricultural fairs.

name: Hudas-Hudas Festival
notes: Features effigies of Judas Iscariot burned or hanged.
description: A community event symbolizing cleansing and renewal during the Lenten season.

name: Katkat Sakripisyo sa 3003 Steps
notes: A Lenten journey that involves climbing 3,003 steps to Linabo Peak.
description: Devotees and pilgrims participate in this spiritually significant trek, symbolizing sacrifice and penance during Holy Week.

name: Live Stations of the Cross at San Carlos City
notes: A reenactment of the Passion of Christ.
description: Devotees and performers recreate the Stations of the Cross to commemorate and reflect on the suffering of Jesus Christ.

name: Pagtaltal in Barotac Viejo
notes: A Lenten play reenacting the Passion and Crucifixion of Christ.
description: The event features the Passion play performed on Good Friday, showcasing devotion through biblical dramatization.

name: Paghukom
notes: Depicts the judgment of Jesus before Pontius Pilate.
description: Involves a reenactment of the biblical trial scenes, complemented by processions and religious observances.

name: Kapiya Display and Pasyon Singing Contest
notes: Custom-made Stations of the Cross are artistically displayed across town.
description: A Lenten event featuring creative Kapiya displays and a traditional Pasyon singing competition.

name: Semana Santa at Dariok Hills
notes: Outdoor Stations of the Cross celebrated on Dariok Hills.
description: Pilgrims undertake a spiritual journey by climbing to the cross-bearing stations, reflecting on Holy Week traditions.

name: Pak’kaat Kal’lo
notes: A ritual offering to nature spirits.
description: Cultural rituals and thanksgiving prayers dedicated to the spirits of nature, involving community gatherings and celebrations.

name: Semana Santa at Silay City
notes: Lenten observances in Silay City's historical churches.
description: Involves solemn processions, Stations of the Cross, and other religious activities within the cultural heritage houses and churches.

name: Flagellants & Lenten Rites
notes: Features rituals performed by flagellants in observance of Holy Week.
description: Participants engage in self-flagellation and reenact the crucifixion to show their devotion and penance.

name: Giwang-Giwang
notes: A ritual procession imitating the swaying (giwang-giwang) of the image of Santo Entierro.
description: The community performs a unique swaying procession as an expression of deep religious devotion on Good Friday.

name: Angeles Lenten Rites
notes: Traditional Lenten observances by the Angeles community.
description: Events include self-flagellation, crucifixion reenactments, and other acts of penance to commemorate the Passion of Christ.

name: Lang-ay Festival
notes: Showcasing cultural pride in the Mountain Province.
description: The festival features Cordilleran tribal dances, local cuisine, and cultural displays celebrating the province's unique heritage.

name: San Pedro Cutud Lenten Rites
notes: Features ritual crucifixions reenacted by volunteers.
description: Devotees go through actual crucifixion and processions in reenactments of Christ’s suffering as part of their vow or penance.

name: Baliwag Lenten Procession
notes: One of the grandest religious processions in the country.
description: Features intricately adorned floats depicting Biblical scenes as part of the Good Friday observance.

name: Folk Healing
notes: Black Saturday rituals centered on herbal preparations for healing.
description: Local healers gather to prepare herbal remedies and practice traditional healing rituals during Holy Week.

name: Salubong (Angono, Rizal)
notes: A reenactment of the meeting of the Risen Christ and the Virgin Mary.
description: The event highlights a colorful and theatrical production celebrating Easter Sunday with devotion and creativity.

name: Malangsi Fishtival
notes: A festival celebrating fish harvests and aquaculture.
description: Activities include culinary contests, fishing competitions, and events inspired by Bayambang’s rich aquaculture.

name: Araw ng Kagitingan
notes: Commemorates the Day of Valor in honor of Filipino and American World War II soldiers.
description: The annual event includes ceremonies at the Dambana ng Kagitingan (Shrine of Valor) on Mount Samat.

name: Pandan Festival
notes: A celebration of Mapandan's pandan leaves, which are key to local industry.
description: The festival includes street dancing, beauty pageants, and cultural showcases centered around pandan weaving.

name: Aliwan Fiesta
notes: One of the largest showcases of cultural festivals from across the Philippines.
description: Features contingents from various provinces competing in street dancing, floats, and cultural performances.

name: Panggayjaya Festival (Bambang Town Fiesta)
notes: A local town festival celebrating the cultural heritage of Bambang.
description: Events include parades, cultural showcases, sports tournaments, and community celebrations.

name: Bantayog Festival
notes: Held in honor of the first Rizal monument constructed in Camarines Norte.
description: Features parades, music, art exhibits, and activities highlighting local heroes and civic pride.

name: Ana Kalang Festival
notes: Celebrates the life of Ana Kalang, a legendary benefactor and founder of the town.
description: Events include the Kalang-kalang parade, exhibits, and cultural presentations featuring local traditions.

name: Hugyaw sa Kadagatan
notes: A celebration of the importance of the sea to the community.
description: Features water-based activities, processions, and festivities promoting sustainable fishing practices.

name: Tampisaw Festival (Earth Day Celebration)
notes: Coincides with Earth Day to promote environmental sustainability.
description: Activities include coastal cleanups, tree planting, and fun events like kayaking, swimming, and parades.

name: Tungoh ad Hungduan
notes: A thanksgiving festival for the rice planting season.
description: Highlights include traditional Ifugao music, dances, rituals, and agricultural fairs.

name: Garlic Festival
notes: An event honoring garlic farming, a major livelihood in Pinili.
description: Features garlic-themed contests and exhibits, and markets for locally grown garlic and related products.

name: Bangus Festival
notes: An annual celebration of the 'Bangus' (milkfish), the city's flagship product.
description: Activities include street dancing, grilling competitions, culinary expos, and trade fairs.

name: Baybayon Festival
notes: Celebration of coastal life and livelihood.
description: Highlights include colorful parades, fishing competitions, and environmental awareness campaigns.

name: Binongey Festival
notes: A festival focused on 'Binongey,' a bamboo rice delicacy native to Anda.
description: Features cooking contests, cultural shows, and exhibits of various ways to prepare and enjoy 'Binongey.'

name: Kasibu Town Fiesta
notes: Celebrates the founding of the town.
description: Features processions, cultural fairs, and community celebrations.

name: Bugsayan Festival
notes: A unique festival showcasing traditional rowboat races.
description: Community members compete in exciting boat rowing competitions symbolizing the maritime heritage of Santa Fe.

name: Cocowayan Festival
notes: Celebrates the significance of coconuts and bamboos in the local economy.
description: Features cultural dances, community events, and trade fairs highlighting products made from coconut and bamboo.

name: La Laguna Festival
notes: A province-wide celebration of Laguna's diversity and culture.
description: Showcases products, artworks, performances, and traditions from various towns in Laguna.

name: Pista'y Dayat
notes: A coastal festival celebrating fishermen’s bountiful harvests.
description: Features beach activities, trade fairs, sports tournaments, and thanksgiving rituals for the sea's blessings.

name: Imbayah Festival
notes: Celebration of Ifugao traditions and culture.
description: Showcases traditional games, dances, crafts, and indigenous rituals that bring together the Banaue community.

name: Pasalamat Festival
notes: Thanksgiving for a bountiful harvest and blessings.
description: A colorful festival featuring parades, dances, and singing to express gratitude to the divine.

name: Liliw Gat Tayaw Tsinelas Festival
notes: Celebrates Liliw's slipper ('tsinelas') industry and Gat Tayaw, the town's legendary pioneer.
description: Activities include a grand parade, slipper exhibits, cultural shows, and a street-dancing competition.

name: Kutsitsa Festival
notes: Celebration honoring local traditions and harvests.
description: The festival features parades, cultural presentations, and community activities highlighting Molave’s agricultural heritage.

name: May Ilaoud Festival
notes: Celebrates the Ilaoud River and the traditions of Milaor.
description: Features fluvial parades, local cuisine, and community gatherings dedicated to the river's significance.

name: Binirayan Festival
location: San Jose de Buenavista and Hamtic, Antique
notes: Reenacts the origins of Antique and the arrival of the Bornean datus.
description: Activities include a reenactment of the journey of the ten Bornean datus, cultural dances, and historical presentations.

name: Saknungan Festival
notes: A unity festival celebrating the province's agricultural cooperation.
description: Highlights include community farming activities, cultural performances, and parades emphasizing local agricultural traditions.

name: Kadaugan sa Mactan
notes: Reenactment of the historic Battle of Mactan.
description: The festival commemorates Lapu-Lapu’s victory over Ferdinand Magellan with reenactments, parades, and other festivities.

name: Dikit Festival
notes: Celebration of unity and progress in the town of Aurora.
description: Features community events, parades, and cultural presentations promoting togetherness among townsfolk.

name: Butanding Festival
notes: A festival celebrating the presence of whale sharks ('butanding') in local waters.
description: Activities include ecological conservation campaigns, whale shark tours, parades, and cultural exhibitions.

name: Indak Padurukan Festival
notes: Focuses on San Jose's cultural dances and heritage.
description: Street dancing and performances showcase the traditions and culture of San Jose.

name: Pandawan Festival
notes: Celebrates Pantabangan Dam and its contribution to the community.
description: Activities include parades, boat races, and cultural festivities centered around the dam and water resources.

name: Tinapahan Festival
notes: Showcases Lemery’s smoked fish ('tinapa') products.
description: Features cooking competitions, parades, and an exhibit of various smoked fish products.

name: Dinaklisan Festival
notes: Celebrates the fishing industry and coastal livelihood.
description: Activities include boat races, fishing contests, parades, and trade fairs promoting sustainable fishing practices.

name: Antipolo Pilgrimage
notes: Annual pilgrimage to the shrine of Nuestra Señora de la Paz y Buen Viaje.
description: Pilgrims flock to Antipolo Cathedral to honor the Virgin Mary, with prayers and religious processions.

name: Mungo Festival
notes: Celebration of mung beans ('mungo') as a key agricultural product.
description: Features cooking contests, exhibits, and community activities highlighting the versatility and importance of mung beans.

name: Kalipayan Festival
notes: A celebration of joy and thanksgiving.
description: Activities include cultural dances, musical performances, and processions promoting happiness in the community.

name: Bambang Patronal Town Fiesta
notes: In honor of the town's patron saint, Saint Catherine of Sienna.
description: Religious processions, parades, and community activities highlight the town’s devotion to Saint Catherine.

name: Araquio Festival
notes: A traditional religious theater performance rooted in Spanish influence.
description: Enacts the Christianization of the Philippines, featuring performances with costumes, songs, and dances.

name: Higawa Festival
notes: An annual celebration of local community traditions.
description: Features community events, parades, and cultural activities centered on local pride and heritage.

name: Martipak Festival
notes: A festival held in honor of St. Joseph.
description: Includes religious processions, street dancing, and other activities showing devotion to St. Joseph.

name: Binallay Festival
notes: Celebrates the local delicacy made from rice cake called 'Binallay.'
description: Showcases the making and enjoyment of Binallay, supported by cultural showcases and cooking contests.

name: Viva Vigan (Binatbatan) Festival of the Arts
notes: Held in the first week of May, showcasing the cultural and artistic heritage of Vigan.
description: Features the Binatbatan street dancing, traditional art exhibits, and food fairs highlighting Vigan’s history.

name: Sagalahang Bayan
notes: Celebrates the Filipino tradition of Santacruzan during Flores de Mayo.
description: Participants dress as Santacruzan characters and parade in elaborate costumes through the streets.

name: Pastulan Festival
notes: Community-centered festival celebrating San Pascual's agricultural heritage.
description: Includes farmers' markets, community processions, and celebrations focusing on local traditions.

name: Pasayahan sa Lucena
notes: A week-long festival showcasing the community's pride and camaraderie.
description: Features parades, carnivals, and cultural events celebrating local traditions and industries.

name: Samahang Bulaklakan Festival
notes: Focuses on the Filipino tradition of honoring the Blessed Virgin Mary.
description: Participants decorate floats with flowers and organize processions in honor of the Virgin Mary.

name: Bangkero Festival
notes: An annual event to honor the boatmen ('bangkero') of Pagsanjan River.
description: Festivities include a fluvial parade showcasing decorated bancas (outrigger boats) and water-based competitions.

name: Tapusan Float Parade Festival
date: May 31 or the month-long celebration of May
notes: Highlights devotion to the Holy Cross.
description: Features creatively decorated floats, religious processions, and a grand parade celebrating the Holy Cross.

name: Calauan 'Pinya' Festival
notes: Celebrates Calauan’s pineapple ('pinya') industry.
description: Participants showcase local pineapple products through fairs, exhibits, and float parades with pineapple-inspired designs.

name: Mamang-os Festival
notes: Commemorates the significant harvest periods of the town.
description: The festival features cultural performances, thanksgiving rituals, and activities dedicated to agricultural prosperity.

name: Davao Gulf Regatta
notes: A water sports festival promoting marine conservation and eco-tourism.
description: Involves yacht races, regattas, and exhibitions focusing on marine biodiversity and cultural heritage.

name: Araquio of Peñaranda
notes: A traditional community theater about Christianity's arrival in Nueva Ecija.
description: The locals present dramatized stories featuring historical and religious narratives in colorful gatherings.

name: Pangisraan Festival
notes: Focuses on the significance of rivers and fishing to the local community.
description: Festivities include fluvial parades, fishing contests, and community fairs showcasing ecological sustainability.

name: Abaca Festival
notes: Celebrates the abaca (Manila hemp) industry, a key livelihood in Catanduanes.
description: Features abaca product displays, weaving demonstrations, trade fairs, and cultural performances honoring local craftsmanship.

name: Pahinungod Festival
notes: A thanksgiving festival in honor of the town’s patron saint.
description: Includes religious processions, street dances, and fairs focusing on community gratitude and devotion.

name: Flores de Tagumeño Festival
notes: A month-long festival celebrating the beauty of flowers and religious devotion.
description: Features Santacruzan processions, floral parades, and cultural exhibits showcasing local creativity.

name: Balangay Festival (Balanghai)
notes: Commemorates the arrival of early settlers on Balangay boats from Borneo and Celebes.
description: Features reenactments, cultural dances, parades, and activities celebrating Butuan’s maritime heritage.

name: Boa-Boahan (Alinsangan) Festival
notes: Reenacts a 13th-century rite offering chains of coconut embryos ('boa') to deities.
description: Celebrated with street dances, rituals, and cultural performances portraying the community’s history and traditions.

name: Sumakah Festival
notes: Honors Antipolo's industries and cultural identity: 'Su' (Suman), 'Ma' (Mangga), 'Ka' (Kasuy), and 'H' (Hamon).
description: Features processions, culinary showcases, and celebrations of Antipolo’s local products and traditions.

name: Magayon Festival
notes: Showcases Albay’s art, culture, and history, inspired by the legend of Mayon Volcano.
description: Includes street performances, trade fairs, culinary expos, and activities highlighting Albay’s natural beauty.

name: Tikanlu Festival
notes: Highlights Tagudin’s heritage and community unity.
description: Events include agricultural fairs, parades, and presentations showcasing local traditions and history.

name: 100 Islands Festival
notes: Celebrates the beauty and significance of the Hundred Islands National Park.
description: Includes water sports, fluvial parades, environmental campaigns, and cultural activities.

name: Katagman Festival
notes: Highlights the historical significance of the golden mask found in Oton.
description: Features reenactments, parades, and exhibits celebrating Oton's rich history and archaeological treasures.

name: Carabao-Carozza Race Festival
notes: Celebrates farmers and their hardworking carabaos.
description: Features a unique 400-meter carabao race, where decorated bamboo carts are pulled by carabaos.

name: Basi Festival
notes: Celebrates Basi, the region's famous sugarcane wine.
description: Festivities include wine-making demonstrations, street parades, and a showcase of local delicacies.

name: Agawan sa Sariaya (San Isidro Festival)
notes: Held in honor of San Isidro Labrador, the patron saint of farmers.
description: Houses are decorated with agricultural products that are 'stolen' (agawan) by festival-goers.

name: Mayohan sa Tayabas (San Isidro Festival)
notes: Celebrates Tayabas' devotion to San Isidro Labrador.
description: Includes parades, religious rituals, and community feasts showcasing the bountiful harvest.

name: Paukyaban Festival
notes: A festival focused on Butuan’s trade and commerce.
description: Features trade fairs, exhibits, and activities promoting local businesses and industries.

name: Bariw Festival
notes: Showcases crafts made from bariw leaves, including mats, hats, and bags.
description: Activities include product displays, contests, and cultural presentations emphasizing the importance of bariw weaving.

name: Palong Festival
notes: Honors the Black Nazarene and Capalonga's cultural identity.
description: Features religious processions, cultural dances, and activities promoting local traditions and faith.

name: Feast of San Isidro Labrador / Carabao Festival
notes: Celebrates the farmer and his carabao (water buffalo).
description: Highlights include a procession of carabaos dressed in colorful decorations, honoring San Isidro Labrador.

name: Arana't Balwarte sa Gumaca (San Isidro Festival)
notes: Celebrates San Isidro Labrador, the patron saint of farmers.
description: Famous for its arches ('baluarte') and colorful decorations honoring San Isidro Labrador.

name: Medina Town Fiesta
notes: In honor of San Isidro Labrador.
description: Activities include religious ceremonies, fiestas, and community events celebrating the town's agricultural traditions.

name: Pahiyas Festival
notes: Renowned for its colorful decorations made from 'kiping' (rice wafers) and various agricultural products.
description: A thanksgiving event to honor San Isidro Labrador, attracting tourists with its vibrant displays and street celebrations.

name: Pulilan Carabao Festival
notes: Highlights the role of carabaos in farming while honoring San Isidro Labrador.
description: Features a parade of decorated and kneeling carabaos, religious festivities, and community activities.

name: Balbagan Festival
notes: Celebrates San Isidro Labrador and includes legends of the slithering snake.
description: Features parades, cultural dances, and events showcasing local history and folklore.

name: Fiesta Bicolandia Cruise (Peñafrancia Pilgrimage)
notes: Commemorates the Our Lady of Peñafrancia, the Mother of Bicol.
description: The religious event holds a fluvial parade and pilgrimage where devotees honor the Virgin Mary.

name: Sarakat Festival
notes: Celebrates the bountiful agricultural products of the municipality.
description: Includes parades, street dances, and exhibitions of local agricultural and handicraft products.

name: Araña't Baluarte Festival
notes: A colorful celebration focusing on San Isidro Labrador.
description: Famous for its hanging (Araña) trade goods and festive street arches ('baluarte').

name: Pahoy-Pahoy Festival
notes: Celebrates the tradition of scarecrow-making ('pahoy-pahoy').
description: Features scarecrow displays, dance performances, and events promoting agricultural past and present.

name: Obando Fertility Rites
notes: Honors San Pascual Baylon, Sta. Clara, and the Virgen de Salambao.
description: Participants dance and pray for fertility, good fortune, and thanksgiving in a colorful, spiritual ritual.

name: Maubanog Festival
notes: Celebrates the culture and history of Mauban.
description: Features a showcase of Mauban's traditional coconut wine ('nipa lambanog') through street dancing, cultural events, and wine-tasting competitions.

name: Sarangani Bay Festival
notes: A beach party festival celebrating the waters of Sarangani Bay.
description: Activities focus on marine conservation, beach sports, and lively celebrations by the bay.

name: Sarung Banggi Festival
notes: Named after the iconic Bicolano love song 'Sarung Banggi.'
description: Includes cultural and musical events, parades, and festivities celebrating Bicolano heritage.

name: Kagasangan Festival
notes: Celebrates Moalboal's marine life and coral reef abundance.
description: Dedicated to San Juan Nepomuceno, with parades, dances, and activities highlighting marine conservation.

name: Tinapay Festival
notes: Celebrates the breadmaking industry of Batangas.
description: Includes baking contests, trade fairs, and showcases of the town's rich culinary heritage.

name: Layag Festival
notes: literal translation means 'Sail Festival,' a maritime-themed celebration.
description: Activities honor traditional fishing practices, including boat races and community feasts.

name: Kaogma Festival
notes: Translated as 'Happiness Festival,' celebrated for the foundation of Camarines Sur.
description: Features fireworks displays, concerts, beauty pageants, and a vibrant street party atmosphere.

name: Bolibong Kingking Festival
notes: Named after the rhythmic music of drums and gongs ('bolibong kingking').
description: Focuses on music and dance traditions while honoring the Patrona de Loboc, Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe.

name: Kaogma Festival
notes: Translated as 'Happiness Festival,' celebrated in honor of the foundation of Camarines Sur.
description: Features fireworks displays, concerts, beauty pageants, street dance competitions, and other activities promoting local pride.

name: Guihulugan Festival
notes: Commemorates Guihulngan's history and traditions.
description: Events include cultural performances, street dancing, and community celebrations.

name: Katang Festival
notes: A celebration of Calauag’s abundance of mud crabs ('katang').
description: Includes cooking contests, crab-eating activities, and parades to honor the fishing and aquaculture industry.

name: Gabii sa Kabilin
notes: Known as 'Night of Heritage,' focusing on Cebu's rich history and culture.
description: Offers tours of museums and heritage sites, along with cultural performances and exhibits allowing visitors to explore Cebu’s past.

name: Sinugboan Festival
notes: Celebration of local history and cultural heritage in Garcia Hernandez.
description: Highlights include dances, community events, and showcases of the town’s historical identity.

name: Binuyugan Festival
notes: Named after 'Binuyug,' Maitum’s local term for unity.
description: Celebrates community strength through activities like traditional dances, rituals, and displays of unity among locals.

name: Pintos Festival
notes: Celebrates 'pintos,' a native corn delicacy.
description: Features cooking and eating contests, street parades, and fairs celebrating the town’s corn produce.

name: Kalayaan Festival
notes: Celebrates the Philippine declaration of independence in Kawit, Cavite.
description: Consists of parades, historical reenactments, and events honoring the country's first freedom day.

name: Wagayway Festival
notes: Commemorates the waving of the Philippine flag during the independence revolution.
description: Includes flag-raising ceremonies, parades, and fiestas, celebrating patriotic pride.

name: Province of Tarlac Founding Anniversary
notes: Marks the proclamation of Tarlac as a separate province.
description: Features parades, exhibits, and programs celebrating the province’s history and achievements.

name: National Flag Day
notes: A national celebration marking the first use of the Philippine Flag.
description: Honored with flag-raising ceremonies and patriotic events across the city.

name: Rosquillos Festival
notes: Celebrates Cebu's famous delicacy, 'rosquillos' (a type of cookie).
description: Activities include baking contests, parades, and cultural showcases revolving around Liloan’s iconic pastry.

name: Mammangi Festival
notes: Thanksgiving and harvest festival recognizing farmers’ contributions.
description: The festival features events such as agricultural fairs, street dances, and activities celebrating modern and traditional farming practices.

name: Bagasbas Beach International Eco-Arts Festival
notes: Celebrates environmental conservation and arts.
description: Features art installations, performances, and events promoting ecological awareness on Bagasbas Beach.

name: Hudyaka Festival
notes: Known as the 'Festival of Joy,' celebrating the province's founding.
description: Highlights local culture through street dancing, fairs, exhibits, and parades.

name: Padaraw Festival
notes: Honors Bulan’s fishing industry and bountiful harvests.
description: Includes street dancing, boat races, and festivities highlighting the town’s maritime culture.

name: Halamang Dilaw Festival
notes: Pays tribute to nature, particularly native yellow plants (halamang dilaw).
description: Focuses on environmental awareness through parades, garden showcases, and agricultural exhibits.

name: Rizal Arts Festival
notes: Celebrates Angono's status as the Art Capital of the Philippines.
